result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J Madison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Persistent Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Persistent Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Persistent Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jesse J Madison in court, in custody with attorney Steven Howard Wright.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held; State calls Judge Bauer, sworn & testifies; State calls Barb Brandt, sworn & testifies; DE calls Atty Greg Vollan; sworn & testifies; Court heard and makes findings that exhibit #14 did NOT go back to jury; State to prepare order; Court denys post conviction motion;

Reason Declined:
After review and consideration of the State's response to the Defendant's proposed Order, the Court has modified the proposed orders and entered two separate orders.
State's reply to defense counsel's letter

Defendant Jesse J Madison in court, in custody with attorney Steven Howard Wright.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Machner hearing scheduled for today; issue on disqualification and post-conviction discovery motion. Discussion held. Atty Wright heard. ADA Tienstra heard. Court heard and grants motion for disqualification of Atty Tienstra but not to whole Dodge County DA Office; grants post-conviction discovery for purpose of issue on whether redacted or unredacted exhibit went to the jury; has not been properly/sufficiently addressed. Atty Wright to draft Orders for today's hearing within 5 days; Atty Tienstra has 10 days to respond to proposed Order. Court sets Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for November 12, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

and remanding case back to Circuit Court

Defendant Jesse J Madison in court, in custody with appelate Attorney Steven Wright.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim bureau appears by telephone.  Atty Tienstra heard, Atty Wright heard, Atty Tienstra responds, court heard and finds jurisdiction in this case.  Court finds $120 in restitution owed to crime victim compensation program.  Court orders restitution paid per state statute from his prison fund.  State calls Alexandria Bentzen s/t, excused.  Court finds the defendant has the ability to pay.

DAY 3 - Defendant Jesse J Madison in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. (8:16) Court reviews and approved proposed ex 3R; Discussion continues regarding jury instructions; 8:50 recess; 8:55 reconvene; 8:56 jury brought in; Court addressess jury; Court gives jury instructions; State gives closing argument; recess 10:08; 10:17 reconvene; defense gives closing arugment; State gives rebuttal; alternate juror selected; Court gives final jury instructions; bailiffs sworn; 10:53 jury taken out for deliberation; 11:32 reconvene; jury questions; 12:54 recess; 3:27 reconvene; jury brought in; verdit has been reached; Court reviews and reads verdicts

count 1 - guilty
count 2 - guilty
count 3 - guilty

Court polls the jury; Court thanks jury for their service; 3:32 jury released; Court heard and enters judgment of conviction; Atty Vollan asks for dismissal not withstanding; mtn denied; sentencing hearing to be set; bail con't

DAY 2 - State appears by ADA Yolanda Tienstra; defendant appears in custody w/Atty Greg Vollan; 8:20 reconvene; Atty Klomberg also appears; parties heard and discussion held regarding DNA evidence; 8:30 jury brought in; State calls Officer Brad Brzezinski, sworn & testifies; 8:45 jury taken out; recess; 8:55 State calls Officer Travis Fix, sworn & testifies; 9:30; State calls Gretchen DeGroot, sworn & testifies; 10:50 jury brought back; State calls Nancy Preder, sworn & testifies; 12:15 jury taken out, recess; 12:50 reconvene; Officer Mike Navis, sworn & testifies; witness ID's def; State calls Michelle Garris, sworn & testifies, witness ID's def; State calls Brian O'Donovan, sworn & testifies; State calls Julie Germaine, sworn & testifies; State calls Gretchen DeGroot, sworn & testifies; State rests; jury taken out; Atty Vollan heard and defendant will not testify; Court questions def and reviews his right to testify; 3:55 jury brought in; Atty Vollan heard and defense rests; Court addresses jury and release them for the evening; 4:03; jury instruction conference off the record; Court to reconvene 8:15am

8:38 am case called. Defendant Jesse J Madison in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Witnesses will be sequestered.  Court makes record of number of convictions.  Court will allow jurors to take notes, no questions from the jury.  Court makes record of how sidebars will be held.  Detective O'Donovan will remain as Court Officer.  Discussion regarding voir dire regarding sexual assault question, arguments heard, Court will allow voir dire on this issue to happen in another room.  Atty. Tienstra argues, Court reaffirms his ruling.  Discussion regarding press regarding this matter and how voir dire will be handled on that issue.  Jury brought in 9:14 am.  Prosepective jury seated 9:22 am, Court reviews information with jury.  Voir Dire begins, 9:26 am.  Jurors taken to branch 3 at 9:53 am, for individual voir dire in jury room.  Break 10:25 am.  10:36 am - back in open court, individual voir doir regarding publicity.  11:26 - Atty. Tienstra voir dire.  Atty. Vollan voir dire.  12:01 - jury taken out for individual voir dire.  12:17 - Court hears arguments on motion in limine, while jury is out.  Atty. Tienstra argues, Atty. Vollan argues.  12:24 break.  12:30 pm jury back in.  Atty. Vollan continues voir dire.  12:41 pm pre-emptory challenges.  12:57 pm - jury selected and sworn.  Court instructs jurors.  1:03 jury taken out for lunch break.  1:05 break.

1:36pm - Atty. Tienstra is heard regarding phone call from witness.  Atty. Vollan responds.  Court will proceed today, Atty. Vollan reserves right to object.  Atty. Klomberg appears now for state, is heard on DNA information.  Exhibits marked, #2 also has #2-redacted (2R).  #1-3 are not to go to jury room, 2R can go.  Jury brought in 1:59 pm.  Court instructs jury.  2:02 pm - opening statement of Atty. Tienstra.  2:12 pm, Atty. Vollan opening statement.  2:20 pm - Victim, S/T.  Break at 3:06 pm.  3:16 pm.  Atty. Vollan is heard regarding restraint, Court orders change of restraint.  Atty. Tienstra is heard, crime lab report has been received.  Jury brought in 3:21 pm, cross-examination of Atty. Vollan.  3:41 redirect of Atty. Tienstra.  Witness steps down 3:47 pm - jury taken out, break.  Jury back in - 3:52 pm.  Travis Fix called, S/T.  Steps down 4:13 pm.  4:13 pm - Stephanie Larson called, S/T, steps down 4:24 pm.  4:26 - jury out for the night, end day 1.

State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Yolanda Tienstra.  DEF, Jesse Madison apprs in person; in custody along with Atty Greg Vollan.  Atty Tienstra heard regarding DEF witness list filed 6/12 and asks to exclude witness.  Atty Vollan responds.  Court responds con't jury trial.  Parties both agree that no con't is being asked for.   Court allows for witness to testify if needed.  Court will allow State's Expert Witness in courtroom if/when DEF witness testifies.  Court orders any evidence  regarding sex offender registry not being allowed during trial.  Discussion on DEF pleading GUILTY to past sexual assault charges - Court allows Charging Clause but remove probable cause.  Court orders Certified Copy.
to preclude State from entering evidence regarding defendant's sex offender status
Order for defendant to appear in civilian clothes without visible restraints for Jury Trial

Defendant Jesse J Madison in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State will not introduce statement from last hearing. Atty Vollan will get civilian clothing to defendant. Court orders no visible restraints. Parties in agreement to general motions in limine file by defense on 4/28/15. Court grants same. Remaining issue - MIL on other acts evidence filed. Briefs have been reviewed. ADA Tienstra heard. Atty Vollan heard. Court heard and believes 1st other acts is relevant - will allow, 2nd in other acts is not probative - not allowing.
Defendant's Motion to Prohibit Other Acts Evidence and Memo in Opposition to STate's Motion for Admission of Other Acts Evidence
Defendant's Motion in Limine to Appear in Civilian Clothes Without Visible Restraints For Jury Trial
for HIV and STD testing of the defendant
Motion hearing on May 29, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Yolanda Tienstra.  DEF, Jesse Madison apprs in person; in custody along with Atty Greg Vollan.  Atty Vollan asks for State to turn over any evidence regarding DNA.  Court grants.   State heard on HIV testing of DEF.  Court grants HIV testing.  Atty Vollan heard on payment of this procedure - his client can not pay.  State responds.  Court will deal with payment if/when convicted.  Court signs order regarding.  State calls Officer Travis Fix to stand/sworn/testifies.  Sequestration of witnesses.  Officer identifies DEF.  Exh #1 marked (PLT).  Cross exm.  Steps down.  State calls Officer Stephanie Larson to stand/sworn/testifies.  Identifies DEF.  Cross exm.  Exh #2 marked (DEF).  Redirect.  Recess 11:13.  Reconvene 11:19.  Apprs the same.  Atty Vollan heard - DEF will not testify today.  Arguments by Atty Vollan and asks Court to exclude officers statements made before being handcuffed.  Court responds and denies motion.  Discussion on search warrant issues.  Court sets Motion Hearing.
Jury trial on June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
of intent to introduce DNA evidence
Motion hearing on April 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on February 17, 2015 at 08:45 am.

8:18 - Defendant Jesse J Madison in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.
from ADA Tienstra regarding plea questionnaire

Attorney Greg E. Vollan appeared. Defendant Jesse J Madison not in court. Prosecuting Atty Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Vollan heard. Court heard, information has not been filed. Atty Klomberg heard,  request to rescheduled. Court will reschedule.  Arraignment scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, HJW, dob 3/2/99 or his residence.  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with any minors under the age of 18.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(1:23) Defendant Jesse J Madison in custody via video with attorney Jessica M. Moeller (will appoint).  Yolanda Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $250,000 Cash bail w/conditions; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 10/9/14 at 3:00pm in Br. 3; Court sets bond at $250,000.00 CASH BOND with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, HJW, w/m dob 3/2/99 or his residence.  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with any minors under 18.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
